intro: Topobea maguirei, commonly known as the Maguire's topobea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sun-like appearance. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
